bug.short_desc: Re-implement setTextSelection() method for widgets that support text selection

long_desc.thetext: With the current API, it is very hard to programmatically insert text at the position of the currently selected text. One first has to find out at what point the selection starts (see bug 2793) and then fiddle with the widget's value.
marked as enhancement, Alex could you comment, please.

@Christian When you talk about "insert text at the position of the currently selected text" do you mean replacing the selected text? If not, then the method "setTextSelection" would by a little bit irritating for me. Maybe "addToTextSelection" would be a better name for such a method. The replacing of the current text selection with another chunk of text would then be offered by a "replaceTextSelection" method.
Just my 2cents.

(In reply to comment #3) This is how the method was named in 0.7, see
http://demo.qooxdoo.org/0.7.x/apiviewer/#qx.ui.form.TextField
However, you are right that the name is confusing. "replaceTextSelection" is much better. I am not sure whether "addToTextSelection" is needed, since you can retrieve the selected text, replace it with extended text, and then enlarget the selection.
